11.15.18  12:49 pm   You seem to be in a bit of a major key overload,

      also a starting-sections-with-the-one chord overload.

      I dare you to record a song that doesn't use the major one as the first chord of the A or B section.

      I don't think you've done that since "what's going on". Just an idea..love your songs, just a friendly dare..a minor song with like a hip-hoppy beat would be amazing from you I think. But don't worry, I'm just a creatively stifled dude who is bitter because I don't have the guts or focus to put myself out there or work hard on my own music, so I critique other people's music to feel better about myself. Hope you have a great day and happy songwriting!!

11.15.18  12:40 pm   Been listening to a lot of joni mitchell lately, and I've been really inspired by her guitar parts... particularly how she uses so many alternate tunings to get some cool fresh chord voicings.. I know you're not really a guiarist, but my question is, do you think that there's any way to figure out what tuning is being used just by listening to a song?

      I was thinking that the tonic chord provides a big clue. You wouldnt tune to open D, but then play in the key of G# or something (if you're in open D, your 1chord will probably be D). But once you throw in capos to the mix the tonic chord clue isn't very helpful (you can tune to open D, but then put your capo on the 2nd fret to play in E, etc)... Also, side question, how does using a lot of different tunings work live? Like were 50% of joni mitchell concerts just her tuning her guitar a million times?

11.15.18  9:43 am   11.14.18  2:51 pm no, i think you misunderstood, favourite things change for me many times in a lifetime as well. favourite things change for everyone i guess. but the thing that confuses me is: (You mentioned that) as soon as you pick a favourite thing (for example a song), a different one instantly becomes your new favourite. Thats kinda odd, does this really happen to you? For example, you say this to another person: "oh yeah this song is my favourite", and then instantly another song becomes your favourite.                   
Why do you think that's the case for you? please correct me and explain what you mean by those "picking favourites"-statements if i am wrong or i misunderstood you
